name: ArtSciLab
description: Focuses on digital arts, media, game development, animation, motion capture, and interactive media.

name: Aging & Memory Research Laboratory
description: Research focuses on cognitive neuroscience, especially in the areas of aging and memory.

name: Axon Biology and Neuroinformatics Lab
description: Focuses on computational neuroscience and neurodegeneration.

name: Cellular and Synaptic Physiology Lab
description: Specializes in addiction, stress, and neuropsychiatric disorders.

name: Center for Advanced Pain Studies
description: Dedicated to pain research and neurostimulation.

name: Cortical Plasticity Laboratory
description: Explores learning, memory, and cortical functions.

name: Healthy Development Project
description: Focuses on factors promoting healthy social, emotional, and physical growth in children and families.

name: Close Relationships and Health Lab
description: Studies relationship processes and their links to physical health.

name: Developmental Neurolinguistics Lab
description: Explores how children learn language and brain-language processing.

name: Think Lab
description: Investigates how children and adults think, evaluate information, and assess knowledge.

name: Learning and Intelligent Systems Group
professor: Leslie Kaelbling, Panasonic Professor of Computer Science and Engineering
description: This group focuses on robotics and artificial intelligence, encompassing areas like machine learning, robotic motion planning, and task execution in complex environments. They aim to develop systems that can learn and function autonomously in dynamic settings.

name: Genesis Group
professor: Patrick Winston, Ford Professor of Artificial Intelligence and Computer Science
description: The Genesis Group is dedicated to understanding how humans and machines can understand stories. They explore cognitive models to enhance narrative comprehension and generation, using both top-down and bottom-up approaches.

name: Algorithmic Alignment Group
professor: Dylan Hadfield-Menell, Assistant Professor of Artificial Intelligence and Decision-Making
description: This group works on aligning the behavior of machine learning systems with human intentions. They study interaction protocols, uncertainty management, and fairness in AI deployments.

name: Media Lab
professor: Fadel Adib, Associate Professor of Media Arts and Sciences; Doherty Chair
description: Fadel Adib's group focuses on inventing new technologies to sense and connect with physical environments. They develop wireless systems that can track fine movements and physiological signals through walls and other obstructions.

name: Mechanobiology Lab
professor: Roger D. Kamm, Cecil and Ida Green Distinguished Professor of Biological and Mechanical Engineering
description: The Mechanobiology Lab studies the mechanical interactions occurring at cellular interfaces, focusing on how these forces affect cellular function and disease progression. Their research integrates engineering with biological disciplines to better understand complex processes.

name: Microbiology Program
professor: Gene-Wei Li, Associate Professor of Biology
description: Gene-Wei Li's lab investigates the mechanisms of protein synthesis and localization within cells, utilizing cutting-edge genomic tools. Their recent findings enhance the understanding of ribosome activities across various cellular conditions.

name: Drennan Research and Team
professor: Catherine L. Drennan, Investigator and Professor of Chemistry and Biology
description: Drennan's lab combines X-ray crystallography with biochemical techniques to elucidate the structures and mechanisms of metalloproteins. Their work is contributing to newer strategies in bioengineering and medical applications.

name: Center for Quantum Engineering
professor: William D. Oliver, Henry Ellis Warren (1894) Professor of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science
description: The center is committed to advancing quantum computing technologies. They are investigating novel qubit systems and improving quantum algorithms to facilitate error-resilient quantum computation.

name: Ab Initio Physics Research Group
professor: Steven G. Johnson, Professor of Physics
description: This group specializes in computational methods to tackle problems in photonics and quantum physics. They develop algorithms that allow for more accurate simulations in materials and device physics.

name: Zwierlein Group
professor: Martin Zwierlein, Thomas A. Frank (1977) Professor of Physics
description: Zwierlein's lab conducts experiments on quantum gases, exploring the fundamental properties of matter at ultra-cold temperatures. Their work is groundbreaking in the understanding and manipulation of quantum states.

name: Computer Science Department
professor: Varies by focus area (e.g., Clark Barrett for Computer Architecture)
description: The department has multiple research areas including Artificial Intelligence, Computational Cognitive & Neuroscience, Bioinformatics, Cybersecurity, and Data Science. These areas focus on developing new algorithms, understanding complex biological data, securing digital information, and leveraging data to drive innovation.

name: PopLab
description: The PopLab focuses on new materials and nanoscale transistors, energy-efficient electronics, and energy conversion and storage. Their research seeks to enhance electronic performance and understand heat management at the atomic scale.

name: SAPPHIRE Laboratory
description: This lab investigates how cells respond to mechanical cues and interfaces, contributing insights applicable to tissue engineering and regenerative medicine.

name: EXtreme Environment Microsystems Laboratory (XLab)
description: XLab focuses on designing robust electronic devices that operate in extreme environments, such as high-temperature and high-pressure settings, which have applications in aerospace and automotive industries.

name: Beel Research Group
description: This lab uses biochemical and structural biology approaches to unravel the principles governing mesoscale biological systems, impacting bioengineering and pharmaceuticals.

name: Microscope Imaging Center
description: Specializing in cancer research, the Microscope Imaging Center uses advanced imaging techniques to explore cellular processes and develop cancer treatments.

name: Baker Lab
description: Engaged in research on plant-pathogen interactions and functional genomics, Baker Lab uses innovative molecular biology techniques to enhance resistance against pathogens.

name: Risk Resilience Research Lab
professor: Jennifer Skeem, Professor of Social Welfare and Public Policy
description: The lab conducts research on mental health, violence prevention, and justice reform, engaging in policy guidance and experimental trials to innovate intervention strategies.

name: Glass Lab
description: Focused on fungal biology and genetics, the lab explores gene regulation and functional genomics to understand and utilize fungal organisms in biotechnology.

name: McCloskey Laboratory
description: The lab researches electrochemical processes in energy storage devices, particularly high-energy density batteries, by resolving material challenges in rechargeability and rate capability.

name: Keasling Lab
description: Specializes in synthetic biology and metabolic engineering, engineering microbial cells to produce pharmaceuticals and biofuels and addressing environmental challenges.

name: Peidong Yang Group
description: This group excels in nanoscience and energy conversion, engaging in developing nanomaterials for sustainable energy solutions.

name: Ager Research Group
description: Conducting research on materials for solar-to-fuel conversion and semiconductors' fundamental transport phenomena to advance energy-efficient technologies.

name: Advanced Chip Test Laboratory (ACTL)
professor: Shawn Blanton, Ph.D., Joseph F. and Nancy Keithley Professor of Electrical and Computer Engineering
description: The ACTL develops and implements new methodologies for detecting, characterizing, and repairing physical defects in semiconductor devices. Their pioneering work involves hardware design, algorithmic development, simulation, and real silicon experiments with industrial partners.
professor_email: Contact information available on the website.

name: Smith Laboratory
description: This lab seeks to understand the brain’s mechanisms for interpreting visual inputs, processing them, making decisions, and eventually generating motor outputs. Their work merges a variety of neuroscience techniques to explore these fascinating processes.
professor_email: Contact information available on the website.

name: CyLab
professor: Information needed (See LinkedIn for current leadership updates)
description: CyLab is Carnegie Mellon's security and privacy research institute, addressing security needs in systems, software, and hardware. It encompasses a wide range of topics including cybersecurity, privacy engineering, and secure data systems.

name: Research Labs in Robotics
description: Dr. Singh's work is centered around the development of autonomous systems capable of operating in complex, dynamic environments. His research spans aerial vehicles, ground robots, and intelligent systems for navigation and operational efficiency.
professor_email: Contact information available on the website.

name: Dynamic Properties Research Lab
description: The lab focuses on studying the dynamic properties of materials to understand their behavior under different conditions. Their work includes designing and implementing experiments to measure these properties, which are crucial for applications involving mechanical systems.

name: Kippelen Research Group
description: The lab specializes in research related to electronic and photonic devices, focusing on materials and technologies that enable advances in renewable energy and optical communication.

name: Planetary Atmospheres Lab
description: This lab conducts research aimed at understanding atmospheric processes on other planets, leveraging computational modeling to simulate and predict atmospheric dynamics.

name: Hammer Lab
description: The Hammer Lab focuses on microbial communities and their role in health and disease, employing genomics and bioinformatics to analyze microbial diversity and functionality.

name: Kemp Laboratory
description: The lab merges experimental and computational approaches to understand the role of reactive species in disease, which is fundamental for developing technology that detects or manipulates biological systems.

name: Alamgir Lab
description: This lab explores materials for energy applications, such as fuel cells and batteries, aiming to contribute to solving energy storage challenges with innovative materials.

name: Xia Group
description: The Xia Group is renowned for their work in nanomaterials, focusing on novel methods for synthesis and applications in electronics and biomedicine.

name: Stanley Lab
description: The lab concentrates on the dynamics of neural systems and develops technology to control neural communication, which has implications for neurological diseases and brain-machine interfaces.

name: Golden Lab
professor: [Pending further search for the professor's name]
description: The Golden Lab focuses on identifying mechanisms related to addiction and social behavior, particularly examining maladaptive social behaviors in addiction processes, such as the transition from adaptive to compulsion-like aggressive behavior.

name: Pepper Lab
professor: [Pending further search for the professor's name]
description: [Pending further search]

name: Fang Lab
description: The Fang Lab studies how pathogenic bacteria like _Salmonella enterica_ and _Staphylococcus aureus_ cause disease, focusing on immune cell interactions and bacterial resistance mechanisms.

name: Cossairt Laboratory
professor: [Pending further search for the professor's name]
description: [Pending further search]

name: Pun Laboratory
professor: [Pending further search for the professor's name]
description: The Pun Lab works at the interface of bioengineering and molecular sciences, focusing on projects that involve innovative molecular engineering.

name: Shoda Lab
professor: [Pending further search for the professor's name]
description: This lab develops methods for studying behavior responses across diverse cultural and socioeconomic backgrounds, applying this to social, political, and educational contexts.

name: Seidler Lab
professor: [Pending further search for the professor's name]
description: Focused on x-ray science, the Seidler Lab explores spectroscopy, synchrotron studies, and x-ray free-electron lasers to push the boundaries of material analysis.

name: Young Lab
professor: [Pending further search for the professor's name]
description: [Pending further search]

name: Pavia Lab
professor: [Pending further search for the professor's name]
description: The Pavia Lab aims to advance understanding of Earth's system feedbacks using innovative isotope geochemistry techniques.

name: Lewis Lab
professor: [Pending further search for the professor's name]
description: The Lewis Lab investigates gene regulation, heterochromatin biochemistry, and cancer biology, with ongoing projects supported by substantial funding.

name: Kwon Lab
professor: [Pending further search for the professor's name]
description: [Pending further search]

name: FAST Lab
professor: [Pending further search for the professor's name]
description: Focuses on integrated circuit architectures for wireless systems, mm-wave circuits, and low-power solutions for bio-medical applications.

name: Laboratory for Speech Physiology and Motor Control
description: This lab focuses on understanding speech physiology and motor control mechanisms, addressing challenges in speech disorders and motor functions.

name: Vashisth Research Lab
professor: [Pending further search for the professor's name]
description: The lab delves into the interface of mechanics and material science, exploring how projectiles impact composites and advanced materials.

name: Ubiquitous Computing Lab
description: Interdisciplinary team focusing on ubiquitous computing technologies related to user interfaces, energy sensing, and health sensing, applying expertise in human-computer interaction.

name: Advanced Controls Research Laboratory
description: This lab focuses on control systems, robotics, and automation, with facilities like a Vicon motion capture system. They advance control technologies and machine learning applications in engineering.

name: Kent Lab
description: The Kent Lab specializes in microbial ecology, understanding communities in ecosystems using molecular biology to analyze microbial diversity and ecosystem functions related to health and nutrient cycling.

name: Manthiram Lab
professor: Karthish Manthiram, Professor of Chemistry and Chemical Engineering
description: The Manthiram Lab focuses on electron transfer processes in electrocatalysts and biological systems, particularly involving molecules like carbon dioxide, nitrogen, and water. The research aims to advance energy, catalysis, and sustainability.

name: Chong Lab
description: The Chong Lab examines molecular mechanisms of gene regulation, particularly the roles of intrinsically disordered regions in transcription factors. They employ advanced single-molecule imaging and genome editing techniques to study cancer biology and cellular signaling.

name: Nelson Lab
professor: //www.caltech.edu/research/faculty-listing) and individual department websites for a comprehensive search of faculty-led labs at the California Institute of Technology. These resources are well-suited to provide accurate and current information regarding research groups and lead researchers in specific STEM fields.
description: Specializes in synthesis, catalysis, and structural chemistry. Conducts advanced research on these topics.

name: Princeton Vision & Learning Lab
professor: Jia Deng, Professor of Computer Science
description: Specializes in computer vision and machine learning, advancing the development of these fields through award-winning publications. Recent projects explore the integration of vision and learning for technological innovation.
professor_email: Email not specifically provided; available through Princeton University's directory.

name: Liberty Research Group
description: Focuses on innovative hardware and software solutions in computer architecture, including multithreaded transactions and parallel execution, contributing to system optimization and security.
professor_email: Not explicitly listed; contact via provided departmental links.

name: Praxis Lab
description: Designs secure and practical systems including operating and embedded systems, focusing on empowering developers through research in system security.
professor_email: Not explicitly listed; contact via provided website.

name: SENGUPTA LAB
description: Engages in interdisciplinary research in integrated microsystems, exploring technologies ranging from microscopic bio-molecules to large-scale infrastructures.
professor_email: Not explicitly listed; contact via provided website.

name: Verma Lab
description: Develops integrated circuits and systems for intelligent sensing, emphasizing electronic systems that incorporate machine learning for dynamic, resource-constrained environments.
professor_email: Not explicitly listed; contact via provided website.

name: Laboratory for the Physics of Life
description: Investigates physical principles underlying multicellular life, employing techniques such as microscopy and microfluidics to model and describe biological processes quantitatively.
professor_email: Not explicitly listed; contact via provided website.

name: Shvartsman Lab
description: Focuses on biological regulation, exploring dynamics of living tissues and mechanisms of gene transcription and tissue organization, supported by publications on tumor architecture and MEK1 mutations.
professor_email: Not explicitly listed; contact via provided website.

name: Groves Lab
description: Specializes in bioinorganic and bioinspired catalysis, including oxidative C-H fluorination and metalloprotein reactions, contributing to industrial and biochemical advances.
professor_email: Not explicitly listed; contact via provided website.

name: Knowles Group
description: Develops innovative synthetic organic chemistry and asymmetric catalysis, focusing on light-driven reactivity and out-of-equilibrium transformations in radials and olefin reactions.
professor_email: Not explicitly listed; contact via provided website.
